NUR205.name: Introduction to Professional Nursing
NUR205.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR205.description: Principles and practices of holistic nursing care that allow for analysis of a comprehensive collection of patient data to provide basic clinical care to the adult population.
NUR205.restrictions: Open to students in the Nursing Major.

NUR220.name: Introduction to Nursing Scholarship
NUR220.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
NUR220.description: Prepares students to become consumers of research who critically evaluate and base their nursing care on evidence. Research methodologies essential to providing evidence-based nursing care.
NUR220.restrictions: Open to students in the Prenursing major or in the Nursing major.

NUR300.name: Pathophysiology
NUR300.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR300.description: How disrupting normal structures and functions of the human body leads to disease processes from the cellular to the multi-system level. Critical examination of the mechanisms underlying signs and symptoms.

NUR301.name: Clinical Pathophysiology
NUR301.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR301.description: How disrupting normal structures and functions of the human body leads to disease processes from the cellular to the multisystem level. Critical examination of the mechanisms underlying signs and symptoms of diseases.
NUR301.prerequisite: {(PSL 250 or PSL 310) or (PSL 431 and PSL 432)} and ANTR 350
NUR301.restrictions: Open to students in the College of Nursing.

NUR322.name: Nursing Care of Acute and Chronically Ill Patients I
NUR322.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR322.description: Focuses on using the nursing process and clinical judgment at a beginning level to provide care for acute and chronically ill patients.

NUR323.name: Nursing Care of the Acute and Chronically Ill Patients I
NUR323.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR323.description: Nursing process and clinical judgment to provide care for chronically and acutely ill adult patients at a novice level.
NUR323.prerequisite: (NUR 300 or NUR 301) and (MMG 201 and MMG 302) and (NUR 205 and PHM 350)

NUR324.name: Health Promotion and Disease and Injury Prevention I
NUR324.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR324.description: Principles and practices of health education, health promotion/behavior change, and health literacy through understanding epidemiology, determinants of health, and protective and predictive factors of health and well-being.

NUR325.name: Transitions to BSN Practice
NUR325.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
NUR325.description: Application of curricular concepts to nursing practice, role differentiation and contribution of BSN nurse to healthcare.
NUR325.restrictions: Open to students in the Nursing Major.

NUR332.name: Nursing Care of Acute and Chronically Ill Patients II
NUR332.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
NUR332.description: Focuses on using the nursing process and clinical judgment at an intermediate level to manage care for acute and chronically ill patients.

NUR333.name: Health Promotion
NUR333.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR333.description: Principles and practices of health promotion/risk reduction through understanding and developing health capacity for populations, families, and individuals.
NUR333.prerequisite: HDFS 225 and HNF 150 and NUR 205 and NUR 301 and PHM 350 and MMG 201 and MMG 302

NUR334.name: Health Promotion and Disease and Injury Prevention II
NUR334.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
NUR334.description: Principles and practices of health promotion, risk reduction, and injury prevention to provide nursing care for individuals, families, and communities across the lifespan.

NUR336.name: Health Promotion for the BSN
NUR336.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR336.description: Health promotion and risk reduction for individuals across the lifespan in the context of their families and environments including those from diverse and vulnerable populations.
NUR336.restrictions: Open to students in the Nursing Major.

NUR337.name: Nursing Care of Acute and Chronically Ill Patients II
NUR337.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
NUR337.description: Nursing process and clinical judgment to manage care for acute and chronically ill patients at an intermediate level.

NUR340.name: Foundations of Nursing Practice
NUR340.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR340.description: Theories and principles underlying professional nursing practice. Development of basic principles for using empirical evidence and the research process to guide practice.
NUR340.prerequisite: (NUR 300 or (NUR 325 or concurrently)) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

NUR342.name: Research, Ethics, and Evidence-Based Practice I
NUR342.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
NUR342.description: Evidence-based practice and research methodology to inform ethical nursing practice.
NUR342.prerequisite: (STT 200 or STT 201) and ((NUR 323 and NUR 333) and completion of Tier I writing requirement)

NUR355.name: Integrative Seminar I
NUR355.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR355.description: Critical appraisal of literature related to health promotion and risk reduction in preparation for an evidence based practice project.
NUR355.restrictions: Open to students in the Nursing Major.

NUR371.name: Behavioral Health Nursing
NUR371.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
NUR371.description: Extension of foundational social science concepts into nursing therapeutics aimed at behavioral health and the care of persons with mental illnesses

NUR375.name: Research and Evidence-Based Practice
NUR375.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR375.description: Introduction to basic research methodology and how it informs evidence-based nursing practice.
NUR375.prerequisite: (STT 200 or STT 201 or NUR 332 or NUR 334 or NUR 371) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

NUR422.name: Nursing in London
NUR422.description: Historical evolution of nursing in the National Health Service

NUR423.name: Transitional Needs in Adults with Intellectual and/or Developmental Disabilities
NUR423.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR423.description: Analyze the complex transitional needs of adults with intellectual and/or developmental disabilities.

NUR434.name: Nursing Care of Acute and Critically Ill Patients
NUR434.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
NUR434.description: Nursing process and clinical judgment to manage and evaluate care for acute and critically ill patients at an advanced level.

NUR436.name: Nursing Care of Children and Their Families
NUR436.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
NUR436.description: Theoretical concepts and clinical application of nursing care for ill children and adolescents using a holistic perspective in varied settings.
NUR436.prerequisite: NUR 332 and NUR 334 and NUR 371 and NUR 375

NUR437.name: Nursing Care of the Childbearing Family
NUR437.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
NUR437.description: Theoretical concepts and clinical application of nursing care for the normal and at risk childbearing families using a holistic perspective in varied settings.
NUR437.prerequisite: NUR 332 and NUR 334 and NUR 371 and NUR 375

NUR438.name: Nursing Care of Children and their Families
NUR438.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
NUR438.description: Theoretical concepts and clinical application of nursing care for ill children and adolescents using a holistic perspective in varied settings.

NUR439.name: Nursing Care of the Childbearing Family
NUR439.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
NUR439.description: Theoretical concepts and clinical application of nursing care for the normal and at risk childbearing families using a holistic perspective in varied settings.

NUR441.name: Future of Nursing: Graduate Education
NUR441.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
NUR441.description: Options for graduate education in nursing. Students will develop post-BSN professional goals. Identify potential clinical focus and population of interest for research/scholarship/practice. Completion of an application to the graduate program of their choice.
NUR441.restrictions: Open to students in the Nursing Major.

NUR442.name: Research, Ethics, and Evidence-Based Practice II
NUR442.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR442.description: Application of evidence based practice and research methodology to inform ethical nursing practice.
NUR442.prerequisite: (NUR 342 and NUR 434 and NUR 438 and NUR 439) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

NUR445.name: Nursing Care of Acute and Critically Ill Patients
NUR445.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
NUR445.description: Focuses on using the nursing process and clinical judgment at an advanced level to manage and evaluate care for acute and critically ill patients.
NUR445.prerequisite: NUR 332 and NUR 334 and NUR 371 and NUR 375

NUR451H.name: Honors Research Internship
NUR451H.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR451H.description: Immersion in the research process in the College of Nursing working directly with a nurse researcher in the context of a funded/non-funded research team.
NUR451H.restrictions: Open to students in the Nursing Major or in the Prenursing Major.

NUR455.name: Integrative Seminar II
NUR455.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
NUR455.description: Integration of professional and scholarly nursing practice culminating in an evidence based practice project.
NUR455.restrictions: Open to students in the Nursing Major.

NUR460.name: Leadership in Clinical Practice
NUR460.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR460.description: Precepted practicum to facilitate the student’s transition to professional practice. Application of leadership concepts, theories, and principles.

NUR465.name: Leadership Immersion
NUR465.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
NUR465.description: Integration and application of theories, principles and practices of nursing leadership and management into contemporary practice settings.
NUR465.restrictions: Open to students in the Nursing Major.

NUR470.name: Community and Population Health Nursing
NUR470.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR470.description: Theoretical and practicum basis for community-oriented population nursing practice.

NUR471.name: Public Health Nursing
NUR471.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR471.description: Use of the public health system to care for populations, including application of the principles and practices of public health nursing.

NUR475.name: Ethical Practice
NUR475.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR475.description: Ethical theory, reasoning, and decision-making with application to clinical practice both as ethical comportment in clinical relationships and resolution of situations of ethical uncertainty and conflicts.

NUR481.name: Scholarship for Nursing Practice (W)
NUR481.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR481.description: Examines the dynamic interrelationship among professional scholarly nursing practice, the health and wellness of diverse populations and high quality safe health care organizations.
NUR481.prerequisite: (NUR 445 and NUR 436 and NUR 437) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

NUR485.name: Integrative Seminar III
NUR485.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
NUR485.description: Examination of the influence and responsibility of professional nursing to society
NUR485.restrictions: Open to students in the Nursing Major.

NUR490.name: Independent Study in Nursing
NUR490.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR490.description: Individualized area of study in nursing.

NUR491.name: Special Topics
NUR491.description: Exploration of selected issues in nursing.

NUR802.name: Theoretical Foundations and Role Development for the Advanced Practice Nurse
NUR802.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
NUR802.description: Integration of theories from nursing and related disciplines to provide a foundation for the graduate student to transition into the advanced practice role.
NUR802.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing.

NUR804.name: Statistics for the Healthcare Professional
NUR804.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
NUR804.description: Basic understanding of descriptive statistics, probability, linear regression and epidemiological concepts.

NUR805.name: Pathophysiology for Advanced Practice Nursing
NUR805.description: Alterations of various physiological systems. Pathophysiology of frequently encountered primary care conditions across the life span and special populations. In-depth case analysis of risk factors, pathophysiological changes, and associated clusters of signs and symptoms. Pathophysiological theories and research as a basis for advanced practice nursing.
NUR805.restrictions: Open only to master's students in the College of Nursing or approval of college.

NUR806.name: Research for Advanced Practice Nurses
NUR806.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
NUR806.description: Prepares advanced practice nurses to be proficient in the ethical and clinical application of research including problem identification and critically evaluate the evidence to provide high quality care and improve practice.
NUR806.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing.

NUR807.name: Clinical Decision Making
NUR807.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR807.description: Clinical decision making in advanced practice nursing. Decision theory and related concepts. Application of critical thinking and clinical judgment to differential diagnoses of common primary care conditions.
NUR807.restrictions: Open to master's students in the College of Nursing.

NUR809.name: Applied Pharmacology for Advanced Practice Nursing
NUR809.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR809.description: Clinical application of advanced pharmacology and pharmacotherapeutics for common disease conditions. Principles of altered pharmacodynamics relative to age, race, and ethnic groups. Cost and benefit aspects of pharmacological interventions.

NUR814.name: Health Care Policy and Politics
NUR814.description: Nursing and public policy formation in relation to healthcare systems organization, financing, regulation, ethics, and delivery of services within a global society.
NUR814.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing.

NUR820.name: Health Assessment of the Family
NUR820.description: Advanced assessment component of the nursing process to analyze the health status of children and adults across the lifespan.
NUR820.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Nurse Practitioner Graduate Certificate or in the Master of Science in Nursing.

NUR821.name: Primary Care Management of the Family I
NUR821.description: Principles and issues of health care management for family advanced practice nurses in primary care. Health promotion, disease prevention, and single acute problems of individuals across the life span and for diverse populations. Analysis of primary care practice topics using family frameworks and evidence based research.
NUR821.prerequisite: NUR 802 and NUR 806 and NUR 807 and NUR 820
NUR821.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nurse Practitioner Graduate Certficate.

NUR822.name: Practicum I: Primary Care for the Family
NUR822.description: Integration of assessment and applied theory in primary care management of clients across the life span. Collaborative model of primary care practice. Health promotion, health maintenance management, and risk reduction strategies for individuals within the context of family. Single acute condition focus. Problem-oriented format for organizing client data.
NUR822.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nurse Practitioner Graduate Certficate.

NUR823.name: Primary Care Management of the Family II
NUR823.description: Principles and issues of health care management for family advanced practice nurses in primary care. Health care management of clients across the life span with chronic, stable and/or multiple complex problems. Integration and synthesis of relevant frameworks.
NUR823.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nurse Practitioner Graduate Certficate.

NUR824.name: Practicum II: Primary Care for the Family
NUR824.description: Integration of assessment and applied theory in primary care management of clients across the lifespan. Collaborative model of primary care practice. Health care management of chronic, stable and multiple complex problems of individuals within the context of family. Increasingly independent decision making with preceptor validation.
NUR824.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Nurse Practitioner Graduate Certficate or in the Master of Science in Nursing.

NUR832.name: Practicum I: Primary Care for the Adult and Aged
NUR832.description: Integration of assessment and applied theory in clinical care management of the adult and aged. Health promotion/wellness, health maintenance/management and risk reduction strategies. Acute conditions. Interpretation and integration of various forms of patient health data. Collaborative, collegial model of practice.
NUR832.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nurse Practitioner Graduate Certficate.

NUR834.name: Practicum II: Primary Care for the Adult and Aged
NUR834.description: Integration of assessment and applied theory in clinical management. Management of acute and chronic health problems, promotion of rehabilitation and health maintenance for adult and aging individuals across a variety of environments. Provision of specialized, culturally appropriate care to aging individuals, family members and the community. Collaborative, interdisciplinary model of practice.
NUR834.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nurse Practitioner Graduate Certficate.

NUR835.name: Health Assessment Across the Lifespan
NUR835.description: Advanced health assessment skills to provide comprehensive, culturally sensitive care. Interviewing techniques, communication, interpersonal skills and psychomotor skills. Analysis of health status including the role of risk factors and health promotion strategies. Emphasis placed on functional implications. Interpretation of data for the purpose of differentiating typical from atypical presentations and recognizing actual and potential health problems.
NUR835.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nurse Practitioner Graduate Certficate.

NUR836.name: Primary Care Management of the Adult and Aged I
NUR836.description: Principles and issues of health care management for adult and gerontological advanced practice nurses. Health promotion, risk identification, disease prevention, and acute problems for the adult and aged from culturally diverse backgrounds. The role of risk factors and normal aging changes on health. Analysis of adult and aging health topics using appropriate models, frameworks, and evidence-based research.
NUR836.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nurse Practitioner Graduate Certficate.

NUR837.name: Primary Care Management of the Adult and Aged II
NUR837.description: Health care management of the adult and aged individual with stable chronic, co-morbid, complex problems and geriatric syndromes utilizing clinically relevant research and evidence-based, age appropriate, guidelines. Planning and implementing therapeutic interventions to return the patient to a stable state and to optimize health. minimizing physical and psychological complications and maximizing health potential. Integration and synthesis of relevant theories and frameworks. Coordination of care.
NUR837.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nurse Practitioner Graduate Certficate.

NUR838.name: Care for Aging Individuals Across the HealthCare Continuum
NUR838.description: Regulations, financing methods, forms of service delivery, and management methods in care of the older adult within a variety of health care environments. Aging of the American society, the impact of the baby-boomer generation, consumer choice, and the growing diversity in care options, focusing on long-term care.
NUR838.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Master of Science in Nursing or approval of college; application required.

NUR860.name: Physical Assessment for Clinical Nurse Specialist
NUR860.description: Development of advanced health history and physical assessment skills for clinical nurse specialist.
NUR860.restrictions: Open to master's students in the Master of Science in Nursing.

NUR861.name: Curriculum Design in Nursing Education
NUR861.description: Analysis and application of theories, principles, and concepts associated with curriculum development, design, and evaluation.
NUR861.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Master of Science in Nursing.

NUR862.name: Clinical Nurse Specialist Role Internship
NUR862.description: Role development of the clinical nurse specialist as an applied nurse scientist, expert in nursing practice, and professional leader.
NUR862.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Master of Science in Nursing.

NUR864.name: Clinical Nurse Specialist Role Immersion
NUR864.description: Synthesis, integration, and clinical application of the essential concepts and knowledge associated with the roles of the clinical nurse specialist.
NUR864.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Clinical Nurse Specialist Graduate Certificate or in the Master of Science in Nursing.

NUR866.name: Academic and Clinical Teaching Internship
NUR866.description: Guided field internship within an academic or health care setting. Synthesis and application of concepts to facilitate development of the advanced practice nurse as scholar, teacher, and collaborator.
NUR866.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Master of Science in Nursing.

NUR868.name: Topics in Nursing Education
NUR868.description: Integration of concepts of teaching, learning, evaluation, and assessment applicable to nursing education within a variety of settings.
NUR868.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Master of Science in Nursing.

NUR874.name: Clinical Practicum I
NUR874.description: Individualized faculty-guided instruction in the management of patients receiving anesthesia, emphasizing safety, monitoring modalities, and simulated patient experiences. Experiences include introduction to the role of the nurse anesthetist and development of basic nurse anesthesia skills.
NUR874.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Master of Science in Nursing.

NUR877.name: Anesthesia Physiology and Pathophysiology
NUR877.description: Physiological principles and pathophysiological relationships of body systems. Evaluation of co-existing pathophysiology.

NUR878.name: Advanced Physiology and Pathophysiology
NUR878.description: Homeostatic mechanisms in relation to anesthetic case management.

NUR879.name: Chemistry and Physics of Anesthesia
NUR879.description: Basic chemistry and physics and their relationship to nurse anesthesia practice. Organic and biochemical principles, and pharmacological significance. Integration and application of these principles to nurse anesthesia practice.

NUR880.name: Health Assessment for Nurse Anesthesia
NUR880.description: Advanced systematic focus on the health assessment of patients preparing for anesthesia, and integration of the anesthesia management plans.

NUR881.name: Perioperative Technology and Instrumentation
NUR881.description: Physics and mechanics of mechanical and electronic anesthesia delivery systems. Physical principles involved in the vaporization and distribution of volatile liquids. Anesthesia ventilators and breathing circuits. Risk management and analysis of resuscitative equipment.

NUR882.name: Principles of Anesthesia I
NUR882.description: Art and science of nurse anesthesia and basic principles of anesthesia practice. History of anesthesia administration. Use and care of anesthesia related equipment.

NUR883.name: Principles of Anesthesia II
NUR883.description: Advanced anesthesia care principles. Procedures and complications in the anesthetic management of the emergency and trauma patient. Considerations for specialty surgical areas.

NUR884.name: Principles of Anesthesia III
NUR884.description: Foundations for the clinical practice of anesthesia. Integrating physiologic patient parameters, didactic knowledge, and technical skills in simulated and clinical environments.

NUR885.name: Anesthesia Practicum I
NUR885.description: Design and management of the operating room. Principles and techniques of sterility, intravenous and arterial cannulation, and course of anesthesia. Basic drugs and monitors, anesthesia management plan, documentation, and ethical considerations in anesthesia practice.

NUR886.name: Anesthesia Practicum II
NUR886.description: Integration of knowledge, skills and program objectives to a broader array of patients in simulated and clinical patient environments.

NUR887.name: Pharmacology for Anesthesia Practice I
NUR887.description: Pharmacology and its applications to clinical anesthesia practice.

NUR888.name: Pharmacology for Anesthesia Practice II
NUR888.description: Pharmacologic principles of drug pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics. Factors modifying anesthetic management of patients.

NUR890.name: Special Problems
NUR890.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
NUR890.description: Individual or group in-depth study of specific areas in nursing. Independent study.
NUR890.restrictions: Open only to master's students in the College of Nursing or approval of college.

NUR890B.name: Special Problems
NUR890B.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
NUR890B.description: Individual or group in-depth study of specific areas in nursing. Independent study.

NUR891.name: Selected Topics
NUR891.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
NUR891.description: Selected issues, trends, programs, or theories in nursing.
NUR891.restrictions: Open only to master's students in the College of Nursing or approval of college.

NUR892.name: Clinical Practicum II
NUR892.description: Individualized faculty-guided instruction in the management of patients receiving anesthesia, emphasizing safety, monitoring modalities, and simulated patient experiences. Experiences include the roles of the nurse anesthetist on the anesthesia care team and development of basic nurse anesthesia skills.
NUR892.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Master of Science in Nursing.

NUR893.name: Clinical Practicum III
NUR893.description: Clinical application of principles of nurse anesthesia. Students will be precepted in the perioperative clinical site. Experiences include development of advanced skills specific to the role of the nurse anesthetist.
NUR893.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Master of Science in Nursing.

NUR894.name: Clinical Practicum IV
NUR894.description: Clinical application of principles of nurse anesthesia. Students will be precepted in the perioperative clinical site. Experiences include application of advanced skills specific to the role of the nurse anesthetist. The final clinical experience demonstrated substantial progress toward self direction and independent practice.
NUR894.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the Master of Science in Nursing.

NUR895.name: Clinical Seminar I
NUR895.description: Anesthesia management plans and outcomes. Evaluation of research and other literature pertinent to the safe practice of anesthesia.

NUR896.name: Clinical Seminar II
NUR896.description: Review of research literature relevant to the safe practice of anesthesia. Presentation of case studies as related to pathophysiological states and safe anesthesia delivery.

NUR897.name: Clinical Seminar III
NUR897.description: Review of research literature and clinical projects relevant to the safe practice of anesthesia. Presentation of scholarly project.

NUR899.name: Master's Thesis Research
NUR899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
NUR899.restrictions: Open only to master's students in the College of Nursing. Approval of college.

NUR901.name: Knowledge Development in Nursing
NUR901.description: Development and growth of substantive knowledge within nursing. Middle range theories. Strategies for concept development and theory testing in nursing research for understanding health status and health outcomes for individuals, families and community-based primary care.
NUR901.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or approval of college.

NUR902.name: Scientific Foundations for the Advanced Practice Nurse
NUR902.description: Analysis and translation of knowledge gained from the natural and social sciences to inform practice and provide a foundation for the Advanced Practice Nurse role.
NUR902.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing or in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR903.name: Healthcare Informatics
NUR903.description: Health information systems and technologies in relationship to the delivery of efficient, high quality healthcare.
NUR903.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing or in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR904.name: Health Policy and Advocacy
NUR904.semester: Fall of every year, Summer of every year
NUR904.description: Interactions between economics, ethical principles, social policies, legislative and regulatory processes that influence access, delivery and organization of healthcare.
NUR904.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing or in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR905.name: Patient Safety, Quality Improvement and Quality Management in Healthcare
NUR905.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
NUR905.description: Application and evaluation of quality improvement initiatives through the use of theories, models and outcome measurements.
NUR905.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing or in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR906.name: Leadership in Complex Health Systems
NUR906.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR906.description: Knowledge, skills and attributes required to assume leadership as an Advanced Practice Registered Nurse in complex health systems.
NUR906.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing or in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR907.name: Advanced Pathophysiology for the Advanced Practice Registered Nurse
NUR907.description: Advanced physiological and pathophysiological mechanisms of the body system to provide the Advanced Practice Registered Nurse a foundation for patient assessment, clinical decision making, and management.
NUR907.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing or in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR908.name: Advanced Physical Assessment for the Advanced Practice Registered Nurse
NUR908.description: Comprehensive assessment including history, physical and psychological assessment of signs and symptoms, pathophysiologic changes, and psychosocial variations of the patient. Specific assessment related to Nurse Anesthetist, Clinical Nurse Specialist and Nurse Practitioner practice will be a focus in the practical experience of students.
NUR908.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing or in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR909.name: Advanced Pharmacology for the Advanced Practice Registered Nurse
NUR909.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR909.description: Application of pharmacotherapeutics for disease conditions including knowledge of pharmacokinetics, pharmacodynamics, pharmacogenetics, pharmacy and toxicology used to guide selection of interventions.
NUR909.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing or in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR910.name: Health Status Outcomes: The Individual and Family
NUR910.description: Measurement and conceptual underpinnings of health status outcomes for individuals and families across the life span. Focus on well-being in health and illness within the health care system.
NUR910.restrictions: Open to doctoral students or approval of college.

NUR911.name: Health Status Outcomes: Community/Primary Care
NUR911.description: Measurement of health status outcomes for populations across the life span within the community based primary care systems. Measurement and evaluation issues related to the costs of intervention to impact outcomes.
NUR911.restrictions: Open to all doctoral students or approval of college.

NUR912.name: Health Promotion – Family
NUR912.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR912.description: Integration of concepts, theories and principles of population health, health promotion and disease prevention at the advanced practice level across the lifespan.
NUR912.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing or in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR913.name: Health Promotion – Adult-Gerontology
NUR913.semester: Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR913.description: Integration of concepts, theories and principles of population health, health promotion and disease prevention at the advanced practice level for adults and older adults.
NUR913.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing or in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR915.name: Clinical Diagnosis and Management I - Family
NUR915.description: Integration of health assessment and diagnostic testing to formulate differential diagnoses for common health conditions/problems across the lifespan.
NUR915.prerequisite: NUR 912 and NUR 907 and NUR 908 and NUR 909
NUR915.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing or in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR916.name: Clinical Diagnosis and Management II – Family
NUR916.description: Integration of assessment and intervention strategies for health promotion and common problems in the clinical setting across the lifespan.
NUR916.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing or in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR917.name: Clinical Diagnosis and Management III – Family
NUR917.description: Principles and management strategies used to construct personalized care plans for individuals including diverse and at risk populations across the lifespan.
NUR917.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing or in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR918.name: Clinical Diagnosis and Management IV – Family
NUR918.description: Integrates evidence-based strategies to deliver collaborative primary care practice across the wellness/illness continuum with patients across the lifespan.
NUR918.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing or in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR919.name: Clinical Diagnosis and Management V- Clinical Immersion – Family
NUR919.description: Evidence-based management of chronic stable and complex problems within collaborative practice in complex health systems across the lifespan.
NUR919.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing or in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR920.name: Translation of Research and Scientific Knowledge to a Practice Setting
NUR920.description: Systematic approach to translating evidenced based knowledge to inform nursing practice, policy and delivery system change. Translation strategies to enhance health outcomes in the areas of wellness, risk reduction and chronic illness
NUR920.prerequisite: NUR 924 and NUR 939 or approval of college
NUR920.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or in the Nursing Major or approval of college.

NUR921.name: Scientific Foundations of Nursing Knowledge Development
NUR921.description: Philosophical, epistemological, ontological, and ethical foundations of nursing. Historical factors and new perspectives in the evolution of nursing theory.
NUR921.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing.

NUR922.name: Wellness and Risk Reduction Behaviors
NUR922.description: Current state of the science related to wellness and risk reduction behaviors and interventions to improve health outcomes for various populations across the lifespan.
NUR922.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing.

NUR923.name: Self and Symptom Management in Chronic Illness
NUR923.description: Current state of the science related to self and symptom management and interventions to improve chronic illness outcomes for various populations across the lifespan.
NUR923.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing.

NUR924.name: Designing Interventions for Improving Health Outcomes
NUR924.description: Foundation for designing, implementing and evaluating nursing interventions for wellness, risk reduction, and chronic illness management across the lifespan.
NUR924.prerequisite: NUR 921 and NUR 939 or approval of college
NUR924.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or in the Nursing Major.

NUR925.name: Clinical Diagnosis and Management I – Adult-Gerontology
NUR925.description: Integration of health assessment and diagnostic testing to formulate differential diagnoses for common health conditions/problems in adults and older adults
NUR925.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing or in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR926.name: Clinical Diagnosis and Management II – Adult-Gerontology
NUR926.description: Integration of assessment and intervention strategies for health promotion and common problems in the clinical setting for adults and older adults.
NUR926.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing or in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR927.name: Clinical Diagnosis and Management III – Adult-Gerontology
NUR927.description: Principles and management strategies used to construct personalized care plans for individuals including diverse and at risk populations with adults and older adults
NUR927.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing or in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR928.name: Clinical Diagnosis and Management IV – Adult-Gerontology
NUR928.description: Integrates evidence-based strategies to deliver collaborative primary care practice across the wellness/illness continuum for adults and older adults.
NUR928.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing or in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR929.name: Clinical Diagnosis and Management V - Clinical Immersion – Adult-Gerontology
NUR929.description: Evidence-based management of chronic stable and complex problems within collaborative practice in complex health systems with adults and older adults
NUR929.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing or in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR930.name: Methods In Clinical Research
NUR930.description: Advanced research designs, measurement and data collection strategies for a broad range of behavioral and health disciplines relevant to wellness, risk reduction, and chronic illness.
NUR930.prerequisite: NUR 924 and NUR 939 or approval of college
NUR930.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or approval of college.

NUR931.name: Wellness Promotion for Diverse Populations
NUR931.description: Introduction to the Clinical Nurse Specialist’s role and responsibilities with emphasis on population health, promotion of wellness, and disease prevention.
NUR931.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing or in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR932.name: Clinical Decision Making and Management of Acute Chronic Complex Conditions
NUR932.description: Clinical Nurse Specialist role in direct care incorporating a patient centered holistic approach in evidence-based management of healthcare.
NUR932.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing or in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR933.name: Clinical Nurse Specialist Advanced Practice Role Development I
NUR933.description: Role development of the Clinical Nurse Specialist as an applied nurse scientist, expert in nursing practice and professional leader.
NUR933.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing or in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR934.name: Clinical Nurse Specialist Advanced Practice Role Development II
NUR934.description: Role development of the Clinical Nurse Specialist expert in nursing practice, staff development, and quality improvement.
NUR934.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing or in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR935.name: Clinical Nurse Specialist Advanced Practice Role Development III
NUR935.description: Developing, leading and participating in the elements of process/quality improvement using principles of improvement science.
NUR935.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing or in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR936.name: Clinical Nurse Specialist Specialty Role Immersion I
NUR936.description: Clinical application of the essential knowledge, skills, and values associated with the student-selected specialized practice role of the Clinical Nurse Specialist.
NUR936.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR937.name: Clinical Nurse Specialist Specialty Role Immersion II
NUR937.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR939.name: Improving Health Outcomes: Scientific Foundations
NUR939.description: Application of the state of the science to wellness, risk reduction and chronic illness outcomes for populations across the lifespan from a nursing perspective.
NUR939.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or in the Nursing Major.

NUR940.name: Research Practicum
NUR940.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR940.description: Participation in ongoing funded research as a member of an interdisciplinary research team.
NUR940.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Nursing major or approval of college.

NUR950.name: Nursing Research Seminar I
NUR950.description: Socialization of student to doctoral study and research environment. Roles and responsibilities of clinical nurse researcher including responsible conduct of research.
NUR950.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or in the Nursing Major or approval of college.

NUR951.name: Nursing Research Seminar II
NUR951.description: Continuation of NUR 950 to advance development as a clinical scholar, program of study, and plan toward unique area of inquiry.
NUR951.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or in the Nursing Major or approval of college.

NUR952.name: Psychopharmacology and Neuropathological Basis of Mental Illness
NUR952.description: Advanced pharmacology and psycho-pharmacotherapeutics and the putative neuropathophysiology of common psychiatric illnesses that occur across the lifespan.
NUR952.restrictions: Open to graduate students or lifelong graduate students in the College of Nursing.

NUR953.name: Clinical Diagnosis and Management I - Psychiatric Assessment and Diagnosis
NUR953.description: Mental health assessment and diagnostic screening to formulate differential diagnoses for common mental health conditions/problems across the lifespan.
NUR953.prerequisite: NUR 907 and NUR 908 and NUR 909 and NUR 952
NUR953.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing.

NUR954.name: Clinical Diagnosis and Management II – Evidence-Based Therapeutic Interventions
NUR954.description: Assessment and intervention strategies for health promotion and common mental health problems in the clinical setting across the lifespan.
NUR954.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing.

NUR955.name: Clinical Diagnosis and Management III – Special Populations and Group
NUR955.description: Assessment, intervention, including group psychotherapy, and management strategies for special and vulnerable populations with mental health problems across the lifespan.
NUR955.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing.

NUR956.name: Clinical Diagnosis and Management IV – Complex and Collaborative Mental Health Care
NUR956.description: Evidence-based strategies to deliver collaborative mental health care across the wellness/illness continuum with patients across the lifespan.
NUR956.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing.

NUR957.name: Clinical Diagnosis and Management V – Clinical Immersion – Psychiatric Mental Health
NUR957.description: Evidence-based management of chronic stable and complex mental health problems within collaborative practice in complex health systems across the lifespan.
NUR957.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing.

NUR960.name: Scientific Foundations of Nursing
NUR960.description: Critically examines factors contributing to the evolution of the development of nursing. Analyze philosophical, epistemological and historical influences on the profession.
NUR960.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing.

NUR961.name: Leadership I: Organizational Leadership
NUR961.description: Analysis and evaluation of organization and leadership theories and their relationship to complex health care systems. Strategies for effective leadership include systems thinking, organizational culture, communication, resource utilization, ethics, and change models required to lead cost-effective quality and safety improvements within health care organizations and in an interdisciplinary environment.
NUR961.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing.

NUR962.name: Analytical Methods for Evidence-Based Practice
NUR962.description: Integrate and critically evaluate knowledge from diverse sources to develop the best evidence-based practice guidelines for improving health outcomes. Explore rigorous methodologies to design, implement, and evaluate evidence-based interventions
NUR962.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing.

NUR963.name: Leadership II: Leadership in Complex Healthcare Organizations
NUR963.description: Interprofessional collaboration within complex health care organizations and systems to transform the delivery of health care to improve access, quality, and safety across diverse populations. Strategies to address organizational challenges and facilitate system wide changes important to the practice environment of the advanced practice nurse will be explored. Group dynamics within health care organizations and communities will be examined with an emphasis on communication patterns, resource allocation, strategic planning, and quantitative decision making models to formulate policy.
NUR963.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing.

NUR964.name: DNP Practicum I
NUR964.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR964.description: Provides the clinical opportunity to analyze, synthesize, and implement integrated nursing knowledge and skills in achieving patient and health system outcomes system’s assessment and needs analysis within the healthcare environment.
NUR964.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing.

NUR965.name: DNP Practicum II
NUR965.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR965.description: Provides opportunities to engage in increasingly complex organizational projects. Participates in implementation of evidence-based initiatives to improve health outcomes and system effectiveness.
NUR965.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing.

NUR966.name: Applied Chemical and Physical Principles of Anesthesia Practice
NUR966.description: Combined coverage of chemical and physical principles and their applied relationship to nurse anesthesia practice.
NUR966.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR967.name: Basic Principles of Anesthesia
NUR967.description: Fundamental anesthesia principles that underpin the development and implementation of a safe anesthetic plan.
NUR967.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR968.name: Advanced Physiology and Pathophysiology for Anesthesia Practice I
NUR968.description: Physiological basis of cellular and tissue functions and the consequences of their dysregulation on essential homeostatic processes in cells, compartments and primary organ systems.
NUR968.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR969.name: Advanced Physiology and Pathophysiology for Anesthesia Practice II
NUR969.description: In-depth study of human physiology and pathophysiology using a systems approach. Emphasis is placed on those physiologic and pathophysiologic alterations that affect homeostasis in humans across the life span.
NUR969.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR970.name: Pharmacology for Nurse Anesthesia I
NUR970.description: Basic science of pharmacology used in anesthesia practice.
NUR970.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR971.name: Pharmacology for Nurse Anesthesia II
NUR971.description: Advanced principles of anesthesia and pharmacology and the synthesis of these concepts into a safe, cost-effective, patient-specific delivery plan.
NUR971.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR972.name: Advanced Principles of Anesthesia I
NUR972.description: Anesthetic delivery to patients with increasing co-morbidities and complex anesthesia needs. Advanced airway management, regional anesthesia and chronic pain management.
NUR972.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR973.name: Advanced Principles of Anesthesia II
NUR973.description: Advanced concepts related to nurse anesthesia practice including management of pediatric, obstetric, neurologic, trauma, vascular and cardiothoracic procedures
NUR973.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR974.name: Introduction to Clinical Practicum
NUR974.description: Application of basic anesthesia cognitive, affective and psychomotor skills in a simulated environment
NUR974.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR975.name: Clinical Anesthesia Practicum I
NUR975.description: Integration of theory with practice in a clinical and simulated setting with emphasis on basic principles of anesthesia and professional standards of practice for the certified registered nurse anesthetist.
NUR975.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR976.name: Clinical Anesthesia Practicum II
NUR976.description: Supervised instruction in the clinical management of patients receiving all types of anesthesia in a variety of clinical settings.
NUR976.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR977.name: Clinical Anesthesia Practicum III
NUR977.description: Supervised instruction in the clinical management of medically complex patients undergoing surgical and diagnostic procedures.
NUR977.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR978.name: Clinical Anesthesia Practicum IV
NUR978.description: Supervised instruction in the perioperative clinical site. Development of advance skills with an emphasis on specialty areas such as cardiovascular, neurosurgical, trauma, obstetrics and pediatrics.
NUR978.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR979.name: Clinical Anesthesia Practicum V
NUR979.description: Supervised clinical practicum for patients undergoing complex surgical procedures using the entire spectrum of anesthesia practice.
NUR979.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR980.name: Clinical Anesthesia Practicum VI
NUR980.description: Supervised clinical practicum on professional aspects of nurse anesthesia and team leadership
NUR980.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR981.name: Anesthesia Seminar I
NUR981.description: Professional aspects related nurse anesthesia practice. Focus on historical perspectives, professional role, anesthesia business practices and professional wellness.
NUR981.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR982.name: Anesthesia Seminar II
NUR982.description: A comprehensive review and synthesis of anatomy, chemistry, physics, pharmacology, physiology and pathophysiology and principles of anesthesia in preparation for the national certification exam.
NUR982.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR989.name: Doctor of Nursing Practice Synthesis Project
NUR989.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR989.description: Demonstrate synthesis of didactic coursework and application to practice by learning a practice change innovation to address a health care problem and improve health outcomes.
NUR989.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing.

NUR990.name: Special Problems
NUR990.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR990.description: Individual or group in-depth study of specific areas in nursing research.
NUR990.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or approval of college.

NUR991.name: Special Topics
NUR991.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR991.description: Special topics which supplement regularly-offered courses.
NUR991.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the Nursing major or approval of college.

NUR994.name: Effective Interdisciplinary Research Collaborations
NUR994.description: Interdisciplinary research methods, techniques, approaches, and funding. Applied research on issues that crosscut communication, nursing, and engineering.
NUR994.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Communication Arts and Sciences and open to graduate students in the College of Engineering and open to graduate students in the College of Nursing.

NUR995.name: Doctor of Nursing Practice Project I
NUR995.description: Introduction of the scholarly practice project for the advanced practice nurse.
NUR995.prerequisite: (NUR 902 and NUR 903 and NUR 905 and EPI 810) and (NUR 916 or NUR 926 or NUR 934 or NUR 976)
NUR995.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR996.name: Doctor of Nursing Practice Project II
NUR996.description: Implementation of the scholarly practice project for the advanced practice nurse.
NUR996.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR997.name: Doctor of Nursing Practice Project III
NUR997.description: Evaluation and dissemination of the scholarly practice project for the advanced practice nurse.
NUR997.restrictions: Open to graduate students in the College of Nursing or in the Master of Science in Nursing or in the Nursing Practice Major.

NUR998.name: Application of Scientific Knowledge in a Clinical Practicum
NUR998.description: Advanced clinical and research skills needed to identify clinical problems and develop research questions to advance science related to improving health outcomes.
NUR998.restrictions: Open to doctoral students in the College of Nursing.

NUR999.name: Doctoral Dissertation Research
NUR999.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
NUR999.description: Original research of student under supervision of major advisor.
NUR999.restrictions: Open only to doctoral students in the College of Nursing or approval of college.
